I wish i could be cute and cool like you guys.

I find this post both endearing and heartbreaking.

I'm sorry that you feel like you wouldn't fit in in that group of people, as someone who has struggled with depression and anxiety for most of my life I get it, it sucks.

The other side is...if you personally for your own reasons and benefits think you wouldn't fit in there...Why? Many people in the cosplay community are people with awkward social issues and they use it as an expression and an escape. You should do the same and at the very least you'll meet some people who like some of the same things you do.

I made the mistake of distancing myself from it years ago in an attempt to hide, worst mistake ever. Be someone else, as long as you're happy doing it, the community will accept you.

I think authenticity and a genuine are things people take away much more than how awkward you may or may not be, in any walk of life. I think (usually)the person who generally notices the things that would make you not fit in with a group the most is yourself.

Thank you for you words and advice. I came across your comment today and it was one of the most genuine I've had in a long time. I've been struggling with my depression which turns into defensive anger It's hard to explain. I'm kind of like wolverine if you go watch the Logan movie. Very hard to express myself since I've faced a lot of challenges in life and I don't have a support group or close friends that I can talk too because I've distanced myself from them as well in an effort to not pick up some of their traits which are bad for me and I don't like to totally express my views especially if they hurt people. I'm just taking my life one day at a time. Thanks for being a cool person and sorry if I ever come off as a tough ass in game. I like to win more than having fun sometimes. Thanks so much though for your comment.

Know what I like about Cosplayers?

They take the game out of the 'game' and take it to a new level of 'fun'. Like Halloween. Being serious, playing ranked, wanting to win: it's all good. But sometimes, as Gabriel Iglesias says: "Have a little fun.". 

You know, how many of us are 'adults'? (+21). We play the game. We work. We go to school. We take life so serious.

What's wrong with looking through the eyes of a 5yo child for while, and enjoying life? Playing 'dress up'. Playing 'princess'? My daughter does it. Nothing wrong with it at all. We could all benefit from a little bit of fun.

Kudos to the Cosplayers, for helping me to remember what it's like to be a kid again. You have my respect.
